items.sentence: Tom saw Mary standing at the top of the stairs in her pajamas.
Tom saw people starting to leave, so he decided to leave, too.
Tom handed me a piece of paper with his address written on it.
Tom\'s cat is always waiting at the door when he arrives home.
Tom\'s house was struck by lightning and burned to the ground.
Tom\'s parents were disappointed when they saw his test score.
We often eat lunch at that small restaurant around the corner.
Tom is afraid because he doesn\'t understand what\'s going on.
I think it\'s highly unlikely that Tom will ever be satisfied.
I suppose you know why Tom didn\'t do what we asked him to do.
I tell everyone that I can\'t speak French, even though I can.
Tom told me that he heard something, but he wasn\'t sure what.
Tom tried to cut the meat, but his knife wasn\'t sharp enough.
You can\'t help Tom tomorrow because you have to work all day.
Tom says that he plans on staying in Boston as long as he can.
Tom\'s French pronunciation isn\'t as good as he thinks it is.
I can get us some tickets to Tom\'s concert if you want to go.
Tom and Mary know each other, but they\'re not really friends.
Tom and Mary probably did something they shouldn\'t have done.
Tom wondered how many more people could fit into the elevator.
How long has it been since you\'ve slept in a comfortable bed?
Tom and Mary furnished their house with inexpensive furniture.
Tom and Mary aren\'t interested in buying a house with a pool.
Tom and Mary didn\'t do everything that John asked them to do.
Tom and Mary don\'t have the time or the money to take a trip.
I don\'t think there\'s any chance that Tom will believe that.
I don\'t think you\'re as good of a driver as you say you are.
Tom doesn\'t know the difference between a city and a village.
I got an email from Tom yesterday, but I haven\'t yet replied.
I googled you and found out that you\'ve spent time in prison.
Tom must\'ve studied French when he was a high school student.
Tom was surprised that Mary remembered what he\'d said to her.
There were three uniformed police officers at the crime scene.
Tom enlisted in the Marines after graduating from high school.
Tom said he knows how to play tennis, but he doesn\'t like to.
Tom told Mary he didn\'t like her scarf, so she got rid of it.
Are you still driving that car that your grandfather gave you?
It\'s probably a good thing that Tom wasn\'t at Mary\'s party.
How many people do you know that don\'t have health insurance?
Tom found Mary\'s constant criticism of him hard to cope with.
Tom saw Mary walking in the park with someone he didn\'t know.
Tom purposely wore his shirt inside out just to irritate Mary.
Tom speaks French only slightly better than he speaks English.
When I told Tom that I was hungry, he said he was hungry, too.
Tom has some very important things he needs to do before 2:30.
It was obvious to everybody that Tom didn\'t want to be there.
I don\'t want you to feel that I\'m pressuring you to do this.
Under normal circumstances, Tom would never agree to go there.
Tom suspected that Mary was the one who had broken the window.
Do you know why Tom and Mary didn\'t go to the dance together?
